DOC.detailed_description: Maternal deficiency multiple essential micronutrient likely major public health problem low-income country . Supplementing mother certain individual micronutrient show confer health benefit , although evidence clear multiple micronutrient . We aim test , cluster-randomized , double-masked , control trial whether give daily multiple micronutrient supplement ( similar composition UNICEF antenatal supplement ) enhance infant survival birth outcome birth weight gestational duration rural population Bangladesh . Over duration 2-3 year community-surveillance northwestern , rural Districts Gaibandha Southern Rangpur , trial plan identify recruit 45,000 pregnant woman base 5-weekly history amenorrhea confirm urine-testing , supplement either multiple micronutrient supplement iron-folic acid supplement ( standard care control pregnancy ) monitor pregnancy health , birth outcome vital status health liveborn infant 6 month age . In ~3 % sub-sample mother , additional measure nutritional health status evaluate 1st 3rd trimester pregnancy , 3 month postpartum ( infant ) , include anthropometric body composition ( bioelectrical impedance ) assessment , collection biospecimens ( eg , phlebotomy breast milk sample micronutrient analyte concentration determination ) , clinical assessment . The trial generate evidence examine safety efficacy antenatal postnatal maternal micronutrient supplement intervention order inform guide antenatal nutrition policy program South Asia .
